title: Space & Place: a selection from the permanent collection
summary: Explore a selection of works in our permanent collection around the theme of 'Space & Place'.

title: Jennifer Wicks residency: Technical Notes
summary: Explore Jennifer Wicks' new body of work, created while at the University of Stirling studying the work of Norman McLaren. Part of the Art Collection's 'Space & Place' programme.

title: David James Grinly: 'ALVA' and 'Altar per la Salvatrice'
summary: The University of Stirling Art Collection hosts two exhibitions by David James Grinly as part of our themed year 'Space & Place'.

title: Space & Place: The Pathfoot Building
summary: As part of the themed year 'Space & Place', the University of Stirling Art Collection celebrates the design of the iconic Pathfoot Building.

title: A Sense of Place
summary: Explore a small exhibition of artworks in the Iris Murdoch Building, organised by the Art Collection and chosen from the University’s permanent collection.

title: Spaces and Places: a reading with Nikita Parik and Shreyasi Sharma
summary: Join us for a reading with writers, Nikita Parik and Shreyasi Sharma, amongst the Pathfoot artworks.

title: Art Collection Open Day
summary: All are welcome to the Art Collection's Open Day, filled with workshops, performances and tours in a relaxed environment.

title: Making Space: Art and movement workshop
summary: How do we navigate spaces and make them our own? In this free creative workshop, led by artist Andy Auld and philosopher Professor John Sutton, we will explore this question through painting and movement, culminating in an abstract artwork, created together by participants.

title: Memory Mapping: Creative workshop
summary: Join artist Orla Stevens for a mixed-media abstract painting and drawing workshop. In this memory mapping workshop, we will be taking a short walk around the University of Stirling campus, to gather inspiration. The class will explore memory, mixed media processes, and how to use texture, colours and symbols to create artwork that reflects journeys, emotions and memories of a place.

title: Writing the City Space: Creative writing workshop
summary: Join our visiting Charles Wallace Fellow in Creative Writing, Nikita Parik for a workshop exploring different forms of poetry. such as anthadi, haiku, haibun, ghazal. Nikita will share her practice in writing about city spaces and lead you to write about spaces that inspire you.

title: GOSSIP exhibition launch
summary: Join us and local artist collective GOSSIP, as we formally launch their newest exhibition Space & Place. There will be a chance to view this exciting new work and hear from some of the artists about their practice. Drop in, no need to book.

title: Music and poetry performance
summary: Each year, the Art Collection invites students from the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland and students from the MLitt Creative Writing course at Stirling to create new work, inspired by our collections. Join us at 15:00 for a very special performance of this work, performed by the University of Stirling Musicians-in-Residence, The Edinburgh Quartet. Drop in, no need to book.

title: Vivek Narayanan: Poetry reading and Q&A
summary: Vivek Narayanan, one of the most distinguished contemporary Indian poets, joins us for a lunchtime reading and discussion.

title: OMOS: Film screening and Q&A
summary: Join us for an exciting lunchtime screening of new work, OMOS, followed by a Q&A with lead artist Rhys Hollis, chaired by Briana Pegado.

title: Art tour at Pathfoot
summary: Join the Art Collection team for a look around the galleries in the Pathfoot Building. We’ll chat about the collection, the current exhibitions, and our Artist in Residence. The tour will be short, and informal, no prior knowledge is needed.

title: Never Apologise: an exhibition from the Lindsay Anderson Archive
summary: Never Apologise marks the centenary of Anderson’s birth by opening up the extensive collection of his personal and working papers held in the University of Stirling Archives. It presents an archival journey through Anderson’s filmmaking career tracing the documentary grit, Hollywood glamour and critical struggles of a life lived behind the camera. The exhibition features fresh new insights into Anderson’s life and work through contributions from actors, artists, academics and curators.

title: PATHFOOTPATH
summary: Artists Peter and Heidi Gardener will be creating an exciting new site-specific work PATHFOOTPATH during the week beginning 3rd October and are inviting staff, students and visitors to join them as they create.

title: OMOS Screening and Q&A
summary: Join us for an exciting lunchtime screening of new work, OMOS, followed by a Q&A with lead artist Rhys Hollis, chaired by Briana Pegado.OMOS is a 20-min moving image artwork that pays homage to Scotland’s untold Black history at Stirling Castle, and celebrates Black and Black LGBTQ excellence and performance in Scotland.

title: Green Week
summary: Green Week takes place every year with a programme of events focused on sustainability, active travel, biodiversity, and waste reduction.

title: Level 2 Certificate in Understanding Environmental Sustainability
summary: As part of Green Week 2023, staff can take a Level 2 Certificate in Understanding Environmental Sustainability.

title: Vintage clothing fair
summary: By shopping vintage and second-hand instead of new, we can help take the pressure off the high street and alleviate the amount of good clothing that goes to waste after only a few wears. Join our fair in the Atrium to browse a range of vintage goods and upgrade your wardrobe sustainably!

title: Green crafting: Green workshops
summary: Running alongside our Vintage Fair, drop by local business owner stalls to learn about their unique, sustainable, products and make a range of goodies from old materials and waste. No need to book, just come and craft.

title: Green kitchen: Get soup savvy
summary: Head to our pop-up kitchen to learn how to use your old veggies and turn them into perfectly tasty soup. No need to book, just pop along.

title: To sustainability and beyond
summary: Join the Enterprise Programme and Scotland’s International Environment Centre (SIEC) for a conversation with industry experts, including our friends from Zero Waste Scotland and like-minded students to learn about how can you, or your business move beyond the basics of sustainability and drive meaningful change.

title: Cycle Cinema experience
summary: Join us for a Cycle Cinema experience in Macrobert Workhouse. We will be screening Becky Hunter’s acclaimed documentary 'Fashion Reimagined' via 100% human bicycle power! Come along to take a turn on a bike, help run the show, and watch a brilliant, thought-provoking documentary with some complimentary nibbles and refreshments after.

title: Dr Bike
summary: Pop along for FREE bike checks and repairs! No need to book just bring your bike along. Any larger repairs can be advised and then booked into the Recyke-a-bike shop. Keep an eye out for other Dr Bikes on campus throughout semester.

title: Gallery Gatherings: Green arts
summary: Take some time out of your day to relax and create in the Crush Hall gallery in Pathfoot. We’ll provide materials and some prompts for you to create your own work, inspired by work in the collection. Free, drop-in and no experience necessary.

title: Puncture repair session
summary: Are you looking to learn how to improve your puncture repair skills? Come along for a repair class and discover hints and tips to make the process a little easier.
location: The spare outlet beside the pharmacy (Atrium)

title: Free upcycling workshop
summary: Join Stirling Reuse Hub for a free on-campus upcycling workshop.

title: Free upcycling workshop
summary: Join Stirling Reuse Hub for a free on-campus upcycling workshop.

title: Keep Scotland Beautiful: Mass litter pick
summary: Join the #SpringCleanScotland campaign to tackle litter. Walk around campus, have a chat, and do your part to reduce litter levels within the community and for our local wildlife.

title: Tree planting garden session
summary: Come make wildflower seed bombs, then help us spread them in the community Orchard to create a haven for bees and other insects. We will also be planting a few trees in and around the Orchard and garden as well! No experience required, just make sure to wear a good set of shoes.

title: Waste stories bookshop
summary: Do you worry about waste? Do you loathe litter? Do you like making stuff up? If you answer YES to any of these, this workshop is for you! Waste Stories will give you the chance to make up some stuff about rubbish in the company of like-minded (or very different) people. Come along, look at some bits of rubbish and make up a story.

title: Social led ride
summary: Come along for a social cycle (leaving from the University) into Bridge of Allan, grab and coffee, and cycle back. This activity is supported by Forth Environment Link; a charity within the Forth Valley area aiming to promote active travel and sustainable food choices.
location: Meet at the Nextbike Station (Beside Bus Hub)

title: Upcycle old clothing
summary: Missed our furniture upcycling workshops during the week? Join this clothing workshop run by the Residence Assistants team. Please bring along at least one piece of clothing and materials will be supplied for you to breathe new life into old garms.

title: Tote bag painting
summary: Run by our Residence Assistants team, come along and paint a tote! All materials will be supplied for you to make a sustainable alternative to plastic bags.

title: Mental Health Awareness Week
summary: In recognition of Mental Health Awareness Week, there are lots of events and activities taking place at the University of Stirling for staff and students to get involved with.

title: Health MOTs
summary: Book yourself in for a free 30 minute consultation with one of our health and fitness team to discuss your current physical activity levels, check your biometric data (on our InBody analyser) and enjoy an informal conversation about keeping your mind healthy through physical activity.

title: Free yoga classes
summary: Students and staff can enjoy free access to all our yoga classes throughout the week - a great way to de-stress and maintain positive physical and mental health.

title: Funded Mental Health Learning
summary: Take advantage of a fully-funded distance learning qualification offered by The Skills Network.
timeAdvice: Available every day throughout Mental Health Awareness Week

title: Journalling and colouring
summary: Journalling and colouring can help reduce anxiety and promote wellbeing. Visit the Library Wellbeing space to pick up a journalling or colouring sheet and try it for yourself.
timeAdvice: Available every day throughout Mental Health Awareness Week

title: Library jigsaw
summary: Jigsaw puzzles can be a great way to reduce anxiety and promote relaxation. Pop into the library and help us complete a jigsaw.
timeAdvice: Available every day throughout Mental Health Awareness Week

title: Library book swap
summary: Reading can be a great way to help manage anxiety. Pop into the library to bring a book and take a book from our book swap bookcase.
timeAdvice: Available every day throughout Mental Health Awareness Week.

title: Anxiety book display
summary: We have an assortment of materials designed to enhance your sense of wellbeing in our Library Wellbeing Space. You will also find the library’s collection of books on the topic of anxiety. Pop into the Library Wellbeing Space to borrow a book from our health and wellbeing collection.

title: Loch View Wellbeing Suite
summary: The Loch View Wellbeing Suite is a tranquil and inviting space, allowing you to decompress and press pause on the day-to-day hustle. All students, undergraduate and postgraduate, are welcome.

title: Wear it Green day
summary: The week will start with ‘Wear It Green Day’ on Monday. Wearing something green is a great way to show your support for Mental Health Awareness week.

title: Global Café
summary: Come along to the Global Café where we will Eat, Laugh, Pray.

title: Mental Health Awareness session delivered by Forth Valley College
summary: In partnership with Forth Valley College, we are running in-person Mental Health Awareness Workshops for staff.

title: Mental Health Awareness session delivered by Forth Valley College
summary: In partnership with Forth Valley College, we are running in-person Mental Health Awareness Workshops for staff.

title: Mental Health Awareness session delivered by Forth Valley College
summary: In partnership with Forth Valley College, we are running in-person Mental Health Awareness Workshops for staff.

title: Dr Bike
summary: Pop along for free bike checks and repairs.
timeAdvice: Drop-in any time, no need to book

title: Dr Bike
summary: Pop along for free bike checks and repairs.
timeAdvice: Drop-in any time, no need to book

title: Dr Bike
summary: Pop along for free bike checks and repairs.
timeAdvice: Drop-in any time, no need to book

title: Make it Green day quiz
summary: Take part in a team quiz at Haldanes over lunchtime as part of Make it Green Day.

title: Guided meditation
summary: Unfortunately, this is now cancelled due to sickness.

title: Guided walk: Spittal Hill Woods
summary: An easy, mixed terrain trail takes you past the Sports Centre and up to the beautiful Spittal Hill Woods, which features great views of the Wallace Monument. The Spittal Hill Woods loop features a woodland path at the back of the Spittal Hill chalets and Scottish Institute of Sport, returning to the boatshed beside our campus loch.
location: The Boat House by the loch

title: Finding Your Path: Coping with anxiety and navigating the transition from university
summary: Graduating from university is an exciting time, but it’s also a huge change. Join this session to break down some of the causes of graduate anxiety and explore practical next steps to stay happy and healthy while navigating this change.

title: Seated massage
summary: These sessions are now fully booked.

title: Seated massage
summary: These sessions are now fully booked.

title: Guided walk: Loch Circuit
summary: Join us for an attractive and peaceful 2.3km trail following the mixed terrain path around our campus loch.
location: The Boat House by the loch

title: Student Union's garden and de-stress session
summary: Join our destressing gardening session and get involved with the people and the community in our community garden.

title: Painting with Orla Stevens
summary: Are you a Student Nurse looking for a creative outlet? Join us for a series of fun and engaging drop-in workshops led by MSc Psychology student Catherine Watson in collaboration with Artlink Central & Stirling University.

title: Guided walk: Loch and Bridle trail
summary: A moderate-level mixed-terrain trail, takes you past the University accommodation and onto the Bridle Path, within the beautiful Hermitage Woods. The woodland trail will lead you onto the Joyce Dunn Walk, past the Airthrey Golf Course Pavilion and around the Airthrey pitches. From here, enjoy a great view of the Wallace Monument and the stunning Ochil Hills. The trail continues onto the loch path, making the most of our beautiful campus.
location: The Boat House by the loch

title: Bike & blether
summary: A social cycle from the University into Bridge of Allan. A hot drink will be provided when we get to a café in Bridge of Allan. This is a great chance to get together have a blether and meet some new faces!

title: #IamRemarkable workshop
summary: In this 90-minute workshop, learn about the importance of self-promotion in your personal and professional life, and how to become better at it.

title: Turn it off and get upcycling!
summary: This Mental Health Awareness Week, turn off your phones and join us to upcycle old garms. Bring whichever piece of clothing, bag or item, along between 3.00pm and 6.00pm and join our Residence Assistants team at ASH social space.
timeAdvice: Drop-in any time, no booking required

title: Happy to Chat bench
summary: Outside of the Chaplaincy, the Happy to Chat bench is a place to sit and have an informal chat with someone new.

title: Walk to the Labyrinth
summary: Set aside time for some quiet inner reflection and connection to nature, slowing down to be in the present moment with a gentle, mindful 40-minute walk to the Labyrinth.

title: Chappy's Chatty Hour
summary: Join Lesley, Chappy the Bear and friends at the Chaplaincy for an hour of conversation and fun on a Friday lunchtime. Try some crafting, jigsaws, share food or just take a break and relax.

title: Alpaca therapy
summary: Interacting with an Alpaca has been proven to help alleviate mental stress, reduce blood pressure, and improve overall cardiovascular health so join in and feel the love!

title: Escape room evening
summary: Ready to join your colleagues, work together, and race for the win? Come along and enjoy this fun escape room evening.

title: Honorary Professor Cele Otnes visit
summary: Professor Cele Otnes has established a worldwide academic reputation in consumer research. During her visit, she will lead several events including II Symposium on Current Trends in Consumer Research and How to write effectively to publish research in top journals.

title: II Symposium on Current Trends in Consumer Research
summary: In this symposium, Prof Cele Otnes and Prof Kathy Hamilton (University of Strathclyde) will present their research "Understanding Customer Emotion Management: How Practitioners Foster Tranquility” and there will be an opportunity to discuss this topic with leading academics in the area of consumer research.

title: How to write effectively to publish research in top journals
summary: As part of her visit to the University of Stirling, Professor Cele Otnes will host an all-day session on how to write academic research effectively to be published in top journals.
location: Court Room, Cottrell Building, University of Stirling

title: STIR-UP nurse research!
summary: Come and be part of a STIR-UP Nurse Research – a national event being held at the University of Stirling on Thurs 15th June 2023.

title: Russia's war against Ukraine: Roundtable event
summary: Our panel discusses the recent developments in Russia's attempted invasion of Ukraine.

title: The ethics of finance
summary: Richard Dunbar CFA comes to the University of Stirling to talk about this fascinating topic.

title: Knowledge Transfer Partnerships taking you to net zero and beyond
summary: Given the current climate, becoming net zero may be part of your planning, but may not be a priority. And that may be due to time and money - two things that are always in short supply when running your business. Join Scotland’s International Environment Centre, part of the University of Stirling, to discover how to have more of both.
location: Stirling Court Hotel, University of Stirling

title: Knowledge Transfer Partnerships Roadshow
summary: The University of Stirling and Forth Valley Chamber of Commerce are proud to present a roadshow to highlight and share insights on Knowledge Transfer Partnerships (KTPs).
location: Stirling Court Hotel, University of Stirling

title: Scottish Cup Fourth Round – Dundee United vs University of Stirling FC
summary: As the first student side to make the last 32 in over 50 years, the team has already carved itself a place in history but doesn’t want to stop there and is calling on a vociferous Stirling support to join them on the trip to Tannadice.

title: Burns Evening and Ceilidh
summary: You are invited to our annual Burns Evening and Ceilidh on Friday 27 January 2023 at the Stirling Court Hotel. Join us from 18:30 for an evening of traditional food and drink, poetry and Scottish dancing

title: Moving Beyond Description: Qualitative Data Analysis Hybrid Workshop
summary: This is a full-day hybrid event involving a morning session with a keynote speaker and plenary discussion and an afternoon practical session, where researchers will be able to develop their skills in data analysis. The event will be held simultaneously face-to-face at our beautiful campus at the University of Stirling and online using Microsoft Teams. You can choose which format works best for you.
location: Court Room, Cottrell Building, University of Stirling

title: Campus as Inspiration exhibition
summary: This exhibition highlights artistic responses in the medium of dance, sound and photography to portray the experience of being at Stirling.

title: Art Collection Doors Open Day
summary: As part of Doors Open Day 2023, discover the hidden treasures of the University's collections. You'll have the rare opportunity to see a Columbian Press in action!
timeAdvice: No need to book, just drop in

title: Inspired! exhibition
summary: In 2023-24 our chosen focus is Inspired! in which we celebrate how our campus and collections have inspired creativity.

title: The Art of Willie Rodger exhibition
summary: See the works and the art that was inspired by established printmaker Willie Rodger in this exhibition.

title: Interior Dialogue
summary: Explore three pieces of work by Scottish artist Christine Borland at this exhibition in Pathfoot Building.

title: Be Connected
summary: Discover a programme of events and activities for our Stirling community of students and staff.

title: Welcome to the Enterprise Programme (online workshop)
summary: Learn about the entrepreneurial opportunities, training, events, incubation community, and funding available through our institution’s Enterprise Programme.

title: Art for Wellbeing
summary: Art for Wellbeing offers opportunities for you to meet likeminded people, learn and experience something new and connect to your creativity. Take some time for you.

title: Art for Wellbeing
summary: Art for Wellbeing offers opportunities for you to meet likeminded people, learn and experience something new and connect to your creativity. Take some time for you.

title: Global Café
summary: International students: come along and join us for tea or coffee, make friends, chat and play games.

title: Global Café
summary: International students: come along and join us for tea or coffee, make friends, chat and play games.

title: Chappy's Chatty Hour
summary: Join Lesley, Chappy the bear, and friends for an hour of conversation and fun on a Friday lunchtime.
location: Chaplaincy - Acorn Room, Loch View Wellbeing Suite

title: Chappy's Chatty Hour
summary: Join Lesley, Chappy the bear, and friends for an hour of conversation and fun on a Friday lunchtime.
location: Chaplaincy - Acorn Room, Loch View Wellbeing Suite

title: Christmas light switch on
summary: Join our Christmas extravaganza to kickstart your festive season. Enjoy live music, a seasonal market and free food and drink.

title: Black History Month
summary: October is Black History Month, and every year we celebrate Black history, heritage and culture with a programme of events. This year's theme is 'Saluting our Sisters'.

title: Commit to change with Union Black
summary: University students and staff in the UK are still experiencing racial harassment and exclusion. Build confidence as a change agent for equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging with this short course.
timeAdvice: Take this short course at any time throughout Black History Month

title: The Stirling Story of Slavery and Empire
summary: Join this free tour of objects related to the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade as part of The Smith's Black History Month tour series.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: The Stirling Story of Slavery and Empire
summary: Join this free tour of objects related to the Trans-Atlantic Slave Trade as part of The Smith's Black History Month tour series.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: Thomas Stuart Smith's Black Portraiture
summary: Join a tour of Thomas Stuart Smith’s portraits of black sitters. This tour will look at the stories behind the paintings of three unknown black men and explore how they represent complex portraits of race in Victorian Britain.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: Thomas Stuart Smith's Black Portraiture
summary: Join a tour of Thomas Stuart Smith’s portraits of black sitters. This tour will look at the stories behind the paintings of three unknown black men and explore how they represent complex portraits of race in Victorian Britain.
location: The Stirling Smith Art Gallery and Museum

title: Saluting our sisters at Stirling
summary: Join us for this live panel discussion featuring student, staff and alumni voices as we talk honestly about the experiences of black and minority ethnic women at the University of Stirling and in higher education.

title: Centre of Environment, Heritage and Policy Seminar series
isSeries: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Join our regular Tuesday seminar series and learn about some of the biggest and latest ideas in the area of Environment, Heritage and Policy.

title: Authenticity's child: current meanings and future destinies for the Stone of Scone
isSeriesChild: Centre for Environment Heritage and Policy Seminar Series
summary: Join this lunchtime seminar with Professor Sally Foster.

title: Smoothie bike breakfast in the Atrium
summary: Start your morning with a quick sprint on the bike and bag yourself a smoothie at the end. No need to book, just come along.

title: History, Heritage and Politics seminars
summary: Join our programme of History, Heritage and Politics seminars and learn about the latest research from University experts and guest speakers.

title: What’s love got to do with it? Building and maintaining HIV-affected families through love, care and activism in Edinburgh 1981–2016
summary: Join this History Heritage and Politics seminar, chaired by Dr Nikolaos Papadogiannis (he/him/his), University of Stirling.
location: Hybrid: Room P.C21 and online via Microsoft Teams

title: The Last Chance to Achieve ‘Modern’ Morality? Practices, Reforms and Representations of Political Corruption during the Second Spanish Republic, 1931-1936
summary: Join this History Heritage and Politics seminar, chaired by Associate Professor Ian Cawood, University of Stirling.
location: Hybrid: Room P.C21 and online via Microsoft Teams

title: A progressive moment? What next for politics and policy in a post-Sturgeon Scotland
summary: Join this History Heritage and Politics seminar, chaired by Dr Sean Kippin, University of Stirling.
location: Hybrid: Room P.D3 and online via Microsoft Teams

title: Immersive sacred heritage: challenges in storytelling at Glastonbury Abbey
summary: Join this History Heritage and Politics seminar chaired by Professor Siân Jones, University of Stirling.

title: History, Heritage and Politics seminar: Stirling PhD alumni projects
summary: A showcase of PhD projects by alumni from the University of Stirling Faculty of Arts and Humanities.
location: Hybrid: Room P.C21 and online via Microsoft Teams

title: Indigenous Presents/Presence: Thanksgiving as History, Heritage and Politics
summary: Join this History Heritage and Politics special event by Dan Cobb, Professor of American Studies, University of North Carolina.
location: Hybrid: Room C22 in the Pathfoot Building and online via Microsoft Teams

title: Global Entrepreneurship Week discussion panel
summary: In celebration of Global Entrepreneurship Week 2023, don’t miss our public discussion panel featuring some of Scotland’s inspiring entrepreneurs.
location: Pathfoot Lecture Theatre and Crush Hall

title: Dumyat Hill Race
summary: The Dumyat Hill Race is the University of Stirling's flagship running event, and a popular fixture on the Scottish hill running calendar.
location: University of Stirling Sports Centre, Stirling, FK9 4LA

title: The Hive's festive buzz (Incubator open house)
summary: Swing by to enjoy refreshments, see the space, and meet some of the innovative incubated companies.
location: The Hive incubator, Scion House, Stirling University Innovation Park

title: International Women's Day discussion panel
summary: Celebrate International Women's Day with the University of Stirling’s Enterprise Team, Careers and Employability Service and an inspiring panel of women leaders.

title: Earth Day discussion panel
summary: In celebration of Earth Day 2024, join Scotland’s International Environment Centre (SIEC) and their panel of experts for a discussion on sustainable business practices.

title: Into the Hive (Incubator open house)
summary: The Hive is throwing open its doors and inviting you to meet its thriving community of incubated start-ups.

title: ESRC Festival of Social Science
summary: University of Stirling researchers are putting on an exciting programme of interactive public events on the latest innovations in social science. This is part of the ESRC Festival of Social Science, UK’s biggest celebration of social science research.

title: Art exhibition – managed alcohol programmes during COVID-19 pandemic
summary: Explore how the art reflects the themes from the study into managed alcohol programmes and how they helped improve participants’ health and wellbeing during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Undergraduate Open Day
summary: An Undergraduate Open Day is your golden opportunity to find out everything there is to know about life at the University of Stirling.

title: Undergraduate Virtual Open Day
summary: Our Virtual Open Day features a mix of presentations, videos and live chat. It also includes our Virtual Tour, which showcases our beautiful campus and facilities.

title: Scottish Cup 1st Round: University of Stirling FC vs Albion Rovers
summary: University of Stirling's men’s football team are playing in the First Round of the Scottish Cup on Mon 25 September against Albion Rovers.

title: International Perspectives on Scots Law 2023/24
summary: The next generation of Scots legal practitioners, researchers and graduates have an important contribution to make to the dialogue between Scots law and its position globally. Join us at our seminar series to be part of the conversation.

title: Logie Kirk Lecture - Is democracy dead?
summary: The University of Stirling, in partnership with the Friends of Logie Kirk, is pleased to host an evening with BBC special correspondent James Naughtie.
location: Logie Lecture Theatre, University of Stirling

title: The important link between professional associations and the classroom
summary: Exploring how professional associations in the language industry play an important role for all stakeholders, regardless of how (in)experienced they are.
location: Pathfoot building, P.LTA96 or online via Teams

summary: Get your dance on at Sports Hall 2 and Zumba the night away.

location: Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

summary: Pop along to take part in a mindful pebble painting activity.
location: Atrium, in front of the security office

title: Neurodiversity and your career journey
summary: Designed for neurodiverse students to find out more about our Careers Service and get support.

title: Loch View's panel discussion - self limiting beliefs
summary: A discussion on self-limiting beliefs - find out how they impact us and how we can overcome them.

title: Staff walk
summary: Take time to get some fresh air and a break from your screen with our lunchtime staff walk.
location: Meet at the accommodation side of the loch bridge

title: #IamRemarkable
summary: Boost your self-promotion with Emily Sandwell, International Careers Consultant in an #IamRemarkable workshop.

title: LGBTQ+: working it out
summary: A discussion about being authentic at work, join us to share your thoughts and talk about your rights.

title: Community garden session
summary: Visit our community garden and feel the benefits of getting outside - it's also a great way to make new friends.

summary: Meet at the sport reception for a student walk around campus.

summary: Take a break from your studies and create a paper flower with fellow students.

summary: Learn about stress and resilience in this workshop and how we can improve our wellbeing.

summary: Escape into the world of yoga for 30 minutes at our student yoga session.

summary: Free lunchtime art tour of the Pathfoot exhibitions 'Inspired!'.

summary: Love books and reading? Come along to our first Loch View Book Club.
location: Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Places of peace on campus
summary: Join us on a mindful lunchtime walk to the Labyrinth for some quiet reflection time.
location: Chaplaincy, Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Chappy Chatty Hour
summary: Chappy's Chatty Hour at the Chaplaincy is where you can craft, play games, have a chat or just take a break.
location: Chaplaincy, Loch View Wellbeing Suite, 2A1 Cottrell Building

title: Build your confidence in how to improve your interview technique
summary: Prepare for an interview with this interactive masterclass for postgraduate students.

title: Climate Cafe
summary: Join our Climate Cafe, an in-person gathering where people can express their feelings and fears about the climate and ecological crisis.
location: Meet at the Green and Blue Space, near the Atrium

title: Behavioural Science and Digital Markets Regulation workshop
summary: A one-day workshop on Behavioural Science and Digital Markets Regulation, bringing together researchers and practitioners from the field.
location: Cottrell Building (enter through C Block entrance)

title: A day for nature
summary: Come to the University of Stirling and help to celebrate and advocate for the natural world.

title: Chaplaincy wellbeing walk

title: 16 Days of Activism
summary: 16 Days of Activism against gender-based violence is an annual international campaign that starts on 25 November and runs until 10 December.
location: Various locations across campus and online

title: Gender-based violence information stalls
summary: Join us in the Atrium for stalls and information about gender-based violence.

title: Violence Against Women & Girls: The Unspoken Pandemic
summary: Why are we not naming what's happening? Join our guest talk on Violence Against Women & Girls: The Unspoken Pandemic.

title: Women only self-defence class
summary: Learn ways to defend yourself in this self-defence class.

title: Gender-based violence First Responder training
summary: Register for First Responder gender-based violence training.

title: Reclaim the Night campus march
summary: Take part in a march around the loch to raise awareness of gender-based violence.

title: Sexual Violence and Misconduct Liaison Officers information session
summary: Join our online session to learn more about Sexual Violence and Misconduct Liaison Officers and the role they play.

title: Misogyny in the media with Stirling Women's Aid
summary: Discover how media perpetuates stereotypes and how misogyny is happening in today's world.

title: Student First Responder training
summary: Part of a sports club or society? This session will help you know what to do if a member of your club or society experiences gender-based or sexual violence.

title: White Ribbon Scotland launch
summary: The formal launch of the White Ribbon Scotland campaign on campus.

title: Imagine a Stirling without GBV
summary: Join our session to discuss what the University is doing in relation to gender-based violence (GBV) support, training, culture change and intersectionality considerations.
